description: The Static Analysis Engine subsystem is responsible for the core logic of extracting structural and behavioral information from the codebase. Its boundaries are defined by the components directly involved in code parsing, language server communication, and the initial stages of data aggregation. The Static Analysis Engine operates as a pipeline where Source File Discoverer initiates the process by identifying files and languages. This information is then used by the Language Configuration Manager to prepare language-specific settings. The LSP Client Core, configured by the Language Configuration Manager and extended by Language-Specific LSP Adapters, communicates with external Language Servers to extract raw code intelligence data. This raw data is then processed by the Reference Resolver and Call Graph Builder to construct structured representations of the codebase. Finally, all generated analysis artifacts are stored in the Analysis Results Repository, making them available for further processing by other parts of the overall system. This flow ensures a modular and extensible approach to static code analysis.

components.name: Source File Discoverer
components.description: Discovers and categorizes source files within a given project, identifying the programming languages present for subsequent analysis.

components.name: Language Configuration Manager
components.description: Provides language-specific settings and capabilities, such as file extensions, language IDs, and parameters required for LSP server initialization.

components.name: LSP Client Core
components.description: Manages the fundamental communication protocol with Language Servers, sending requests for code analysis data (e.g., symbols, definitions, references) and processing the received responses.

components.name: Language-Specific LSP Adapters
components.description: Extends the core LSP client with language-specific initialization, project bootstrapping, and configuration validation to ensure accurate analysis of projects in various programming languages (e.g., TypeScript).

components.name: Reference Resolver
components.description: Resolves and normalizes code references, ensuring that all cross-file and internal code references are accurately linked and identifiable within the codebase.

components.name: Call Graph Builder
components.description: Constructs and maintains the call graph of the codebase, representing function/method calls and their interdependencies as a directed graph.

components.name: Analysis Results Repository
components.description: Serves as a central repository for all collected static analysis data, including Control Flow Graphs (CFG), class hierarchies, package dependencies, and resolved references.
